Key Match Events: Tyler Herro recorded 23 points, seven rebounds and five assists on 7-of-17 shooting, including 4-of-10 from 3-point range.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. tallied a season-high 20 points, including a critical above-the-break 3-pointer to put the Heat ahead by five points with 1:03 left.
Lauri Markkanen and Collin Sexton each had 23 points apiece for the Jazz.
Pre-Game Insights: The Heat were less than a week removed from losing to the Utah Jazz at home by 36 points.
The Jazz dropped to 9-27 while the Heat moved to 19-17.
Post-Match Reflections: Miami’s win moves them closer to extending their winning streak to three games.
There is optimism around the team’s future with Jimmy Butler absent, as young players are performing well.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat shot 39.8 percent from the field and 30.6 percent from 3-point range.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. made a season-high six 3-pointers in the fourth quarter.
The teams combined for just 87 points in the first half.
